intro: Heliocarpus polyandrus, commonly known as the yellow ironwood, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and distinctive yellowish bark. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in wetland and swampy environments, often forming dense thickets. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
